news.title: Vascular disease after age 80 associated with greater risk of dementia
news.summary: People who reach their 80s without cardiovascular disease are more likely to suffer from the effects of dementia than a heart attack or stroke, according to a study today in the Journal of the American College of Cardiology.

news.title: Vascular Disease after Age 80 Associated with Greater Dementia Risk
news.summary: March 15, 2016 — People who reach their 80s without cardiovascular disease are more likely to suffer from the effects of dementia than a heart attack or stroke, according to a study in the Journal of the American College of Cardiology (JACC).
